sources.title: Where Eagles Dare (1968) Richard Burton · Clint Eastwood
sources.description: During World War II, a special unit of the British secret service is tasked with rescuing an American general captured by the Germans from an Alpine fortress. It's a lurid, implausible, and overly long war film that derives its suspense primarily from the question of who is on which side and who is a traitor or double agent.

sources.title: Where Eagles Dare (1968)
sources.description: Where Eagles Dare is a 1968 action adventure war film directed by Brian G. Hutton and starring Richard Burton, Clint Eastwood and Mary Ure. The film follows a  team of Allied agents, led by Major John Smith and Lieutenant Morris Schaffer, is tasked with rescuing American Brigadier General George Carnaby from a heavily fortified German castle. As the mission unfolds, they encounter unexpected betrayals and must navigate a web of deception to succeed in their dangerous operation.

metadata.Plot: During World War II, a British aircraft is shot down and crashes in Nazi held territory. The Germans capture the only survivor, American Brigadier General George Carnaby (Robert Beatty), and take him to the nearest S.S. headquarters. Unknown to the Germans, the General has full knowledge of the D-Day operation. The British decide that the General must not be allowed to divulge any details of the Normandy landing at all costs, and order Major Jonathan Smith (Richard Burton) to lead a crack commando team to rescue him. Amongst the team is an American Ranger, Lieutenant Morris Schaffer (Clint Eastwood), who is puzzled by his inclusion in an all British operation. When one of the team dies after the parachute drop, Schaffer suspects that Smith's mission has a much more secret objective.
metadata.Actors: Richard Burton, Clint Eastwood, Mary Ure
